resources.string: Please name your car before adding it to your collection
Units: Gj for natural gas, kwh for electricity
Add a journey or utility to start tracking your Carbon Footprint!
Show emission units as amount of days it would take for 10 trees to process
You haven\'t entered any utilities in a while, would you like to enter one?
You haven\'t entered any utilities yet, would you like to enter one to track your household Carbon Footprint?
You haven\'t added any journeys yet, add some to start tracking your commuter Carbon Footprint.
You haven\'t added any journeys today, would you like to add one?
You entered %1$d journeys today, would you like to add any more?
There are no more tips available. More tips will be made available if you add a Journey.

string-array.name: tips_array
string-array.item: On your last added journey, you had %1$dkg emissions. Carpool with commuters that share similar trips to yours.
On your last journey, your transport emitted %1$dkg. If looking to get a new car, take into consideration fuel efficiency when choosing which vehicle to get.
Your last trip emitted %1$dkg. When possible, take a bus instead of a taxi or other forms of single-passenger transportation.
You emitted %1$d kg of CO2 on your last journey. Try to prevent stopping and accelerating as much as you can when driving.
The emissions of your last journey was %1$dkg. If you drive and encounter traffic, turn off your engine to prevent idling for long periods of time.
On your last trip, you traveled %1$d kilometers. Try to plan trips beforehand take the most direct path to your destination to avoid taking detours that will add to your trip length.
Your last journey produced %1$dkg of emissions. If going short distances, consider walking, biking, or other forms of zero-emission transportation.
You emitted %1$dkg of CO2 on your last trip. If you drive, make sure your wheels are fully inflated, as flatter tires greatly increase your emissions.
On your last bill, you used %1$dGj of Natural Gas. Taking shorter showers can help greatly reduce the amount of hot water you use, which will reduce your carbon footprint.
You generated %1$dkg of CO2 over the period of your last bill. Washing clothes in cold water will reduce the amount of unnecessary hot water you use.
Your household used %1$dGj of Natural gas, according to your last entered Natural Gas bill. Turning off heating on warmer days will drastically decrease the amount of gas used for heating.
On your last entered bill, the usage of Natural Gas in your household generated %1$dkg of CO2. If it is cold, put on a sweatshirt instead of turning up the heat.

The Electricity used over the period of your last entered bill, generated %1$dkg of CO2. Using compact fluorescent light bulbs will cut down on your electric bill and also increase the brightness of the rooms you are trying to light!
On your most recent electric bill, you household used %1$dkwh of Electricity. Unplugging electrical appliances that are not in use will reduce the amount of ambient electricity you use.
Your usage of Electricity for your last entered bill, created %1$dkg of CO2. During the warmer months, hang your clothes up to dry instead of using a drying machine to cut down on your electric bill.

Your last bill shows that your household used %1$dkwh of Electricity over the entered period. When you go on a vacation, turn off the heating in your house and put your water heater on "vacation" setting if possible.
